intro: Westoniella kohkemperi, commonly known as the yellow bell heath, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
